definitions.definition: remain in the same place.
examples: you stay here and I'll be back soon

definitions.definition: delay leaving so as to join in (an activity).
(of food) remain in the stomach, rather than be thrown up as vomit.
remain in a specified state or position.
synonyms: tarry "he stayed where he was"continue (to be)
go on being "they won't stay hidden"

definitions.definition: (of a person) live somewhere temporarily as a visitor or guest.
examples: the girls had gone to stay with friends

definitions.definition: live permanently.
stop, delay, or prevent (something), in particular suspend or postpone (judicial proceedings) or refrain from pressing (charges).
examples: postpone, put off, delay, defer, put back, hold over/off; Moreadjourn, suspend, prorogue, put over, table, lay on the table, take a rain check on; continue; informalput on ice, put on the back burner "legal proceedings were stayed"delay, slow down/up, hold back/up, set back, keep back, put back, put a brake on, retard; hinder, hamper, obstruct, inhibit, impede, curb, check, restrain, restrict, arrest; informalthrow a (monkey) wrench in the works of "we must stay the enemy's advance"Moreadjourn, suspend, prorogue, put over, table, lay on the table, take a rain check on; continue; put on ice, put on the back burner legal proceedings were stayeddelay, slow down/up, hold back/up, set back, keep back, put back, put a brake on, retard; hinder, hamper, obstruct, inhibit, impede, curb, check, restrain, restrict, arrest; throw a (monkey) wrench in the works of we must stay the enemy's advance

definitions.definition: assuage (hunger) for a short time.
examples: I grabbed something to stay the pangs of hunger

definitions.definition: curb; check.
examples: he tries to stay the destructive course of barbarism

definitions.definition: wait a moment in order to allow someone time to think or speak.
examples: stay, stand apart, I know not which is which

definitions.definition: support or prop up.
a period of staying somewhere, in particular of living somewhere temporarily as a visitor or guest.
examples: an overnight stay at a luxury hotel
synonyms: vacation; formalsojourn "a stay at a hotel"

definitions.definition: a curb or check.
examples: there is likely to be a good public library as a stay against boredom

definitions.definition: a suspension or postponement of judicial proceedings.
a device used as a brace or support.
a corset made of two pieces laced together and stiffened by strips of whalebone.
power of endurance.
a large rope, wire, or rod used to support a ship's mast, leading from the masthead to another mast or spar or down to the deck.
examples: strut, wire, brace, tether, guy, prop, rod, support, truss; shroud the stays holding up the mast

definitions.definition: a guy or rope supporting a flagpole or other upright pole.
a supporting wire or cable on an aircraft.
secure or steady (a mast) by means of stays.
examples: brace, tether, strut, wire, guy, prop, support, truss her masts were well stayed
